title: Minimum(ish) Working Example of Quarto with Arabic RTL text in an LTR document
text:
Preface

بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم

This is a MWE of a Quarto book that is in left-to-right text (English), with portions of right-to-left text (Arabic) in it. Examples:

The basmalah above.
This inline text: العربية

To learn how to type Arabic text and its transcription/transliteration see the next chapter 1  Introduction مقدمة الكتاب.
The source code for this book can be found here: https://github.com/adamiturabi/quarto-arabic-mwe.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

title: 1  Introduction مقدمة الكتاب
1  Introduction مقدمة الكتاب
text:
1.2 Transcription of Arabic al-ɛarabiyyah
This is the transcription of the above Arabic text: hād͡hā kalāmun ɛarabiyyun.. It has been typed in the .qmd markdown source thus:
[hApA kalAmun earabiyyun.]{.trn}
Another custom pandoc filter transliteration-span.lua processes the above ASCII and adds the Unicode dots, macrons, and other diacritics to render it correctly.
The mapping for ASCII to transliterated output is also found in the Lua file for the filter.
By default, it renders the transcription in italics.

title: 1  Introduction مقدمة الكتاب
text:
1.3 Non-italic transliteration of Arabic
Sometimes, we may wish to use a transliteration in the English text unitalicized. This is ofter done for names like Ɛumar (عُمَر) and ʾUsāmah (أُسَامَة).
These are typed thus: [#eumar]{.trn2} and [E#usAmah]{.trn2}
Note how the hash character # is used to capitalize a letter in the rendered output. trn2 indicates non-italic output.

title: 1  Introduction مقدمة الكتاب
text:
1.4 Arabic divs
This is an Arabic div:

هذا كلام عربي طويل. أريد أن أكتب حتى يبلغ الكلام سطرين. أستعمل برنامج قواطرو لإنتاج الملف الخارجي. هو برنامج جيد قد خلف البرنامج بكداؤن الذي كنت أستعمله من قبل.

It is typed thus:
::: {.otherlanguage data-latex="{arabic}" lang="ar"}
<Arabic text here>
:::
The .otherlanguage and data-latex="{arabic}" are needed for the correct Latex syntax.

1.5 Fonts

1.5.1 Arabic font

1.5.1.1 PDF output
For PDF output, the Arabic font is specified in the file srctex/before-title.tex thus:
\babelfont[arabic]{rm}[Language=Default]{Vazirmatn-Light}
\babelfont[arabic]{sf}[Language=Default]{Vazirmatn-Light}


1.5.1.2 HTML output
For HTML output, the Arabic font is specified using CSS. This can be done for per class. TODO.
